intro: Deschampsia gulariantzii, commonly known as the alpine feathergrass, is a perennial grass species native to the high-altitude regions of the western United States. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of high-altitude ecosystems.
